name: St. Pierre Islet: Rings of Foam
description:
Tropicbirds, 5 ring waves, 1 coral window. Siren rune flashes.

Riddle: "The smallest portal frames the biggest sea."

Sophisticated painterly artwork using etched-parchment technique with Seychellois cultural motifs. Part of "The Siren's Map of Praslin" cipher series.

attributes.value: VII - The Siren's Map of Praslin

advanced_specs.render_prompt: Etched parchment engraved map-card of Tropicbirds, 5 ring waves, 1 coral window. Siren rune flashes.. mystical_islet_siren_energy with foam_spray_ethereal_light. Dense foliage, rhythmic Seychellois motifs, saturated greens/blues/yellows. background_open_sea_midground_waves_foreground_coral_window. Fine copperplate hatching, visible brush strokes, textured overlays. Cultural stamps: tropicbird_flight_patterns, siren_rune_glow. Volumetric depth, painterly effects, living busy scene. Etched-map caption strip with gold title. 17th-century nautical chart + Seychellois modernist painting, ritualistic archaeological mood.
advanced_specs.negative_prompt: flat shapes, primitive graphics, basic fills, simple geometry, vector primitives, plain colors, childlike, cartoon, modern technology, photoreal, neon, low detail

puzzle_data.scene: Tropicbirds, 5 ring waves, 1 coral window. Siren rune flashes.
puzzle_data.riddle: The smallest portal frames the biggest sea.
